title: Enrollment
context: §88-44 Enrollment. Upon entering or reentering service, an employee shall file with the board such information as the board of trustees may require for enrollment and administrative purposes including a designation of a person or persons to receive any benefit that may be payable in the event of the employee&rsquo;s death. An employee becoming a member of the system shall also present at such time and in such form as the board prescribes, evidence of the employee&rsquo;s date of birth. No statement or record of age or birth made or presented by a member of the system may be impeached by the member or the member&rsquo;s successors in interest. [L 1941, c 225, §1; RL 1945, §706; RL 1955, §6-27; am L 1963, c 127, §1; HRS §88-44; am L 1969, c 110, pt of §1; gen ch 1985]
